content: of the row 1 *p1 k2** repeat from * to ** across to the end of the row stem gather up the 18 sts around the top of the stem and carefully sew the gathered- row 2 *p2 k1** repeat from * to ** across to the end of the row up edge to the stem with neat whip stitches row 3-12 repeat last 2 row five times or until the knitting measures about sew the cap underside row ends seam with mattress stitch then weave in the tail 2 5cm/ 1in from the cast-on edge ends as neatly as possible - see figs 5 6 7 8 & 9 row 13 *p1 skpo** repeat from * to ** across to the end of the row - 36sts cap top row 14 *p1 k1** repeat from * to ** across to the end of the row beginning at the edge of the cap with yarn c cast on *54 sts row 15 p2tog skpo 18 times - 18sts row 1-15 beginning with a purl row work 15 row stocking stitch cut yarn thread end through all 18 sts continue as follows row 16 *k1 k2tog** repeat from * to ** across to the end of the row - 36sts row 17 purl row 18 k2tog repeat across to the end of the row - 18sts row 19 purl row 20 k2tog repeat across to the end of the row - 9sts cut yarn thread end through all 9 sts pull up to a tight gather and secure the end use the tail end to sew the seam along the row ends return to the light add a blob of glue to the top of the balloon light then place the ws of the cap top over the balloon light adhering the gathered-up centre of the cap top onto the top fig 7 fig 8 of the light for neatness sake align the seam of the cap with the seam of the cap underside - see fig 10 *if you wanted a more hooded mushroom cast on 45 sts and work the pattern similarly you ll not on row 20 you ll need to knit the last stitch = 8sts - see fig 11 fig 9 fig 10 fig 11 mushroom lantern page 8 mushroom lantern page 9 check the glue is dry before continuing as follows join the cap to the cap underside pin the cap to the cap underside and sewing one to the other as neatly as possible with whip stitch the final thing to do is this - the light switches on and off by gently pulling up the bulb so pulling it almost free of the stopper - you don t want to pull it completely free as it s tricky once the cap is sewn to its underside to wiggle it back on so make a few discrete stitches to join the underside at the top near the stem to the cap top -
